summary: This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons financial and housing records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein from the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It includes a Western Union money transfer to his account, his cell assignment history from 2018-2019, and commissary sales invoices detailing his purchases in the months leading up to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all records; an inmate at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with registration number 85993-054/76318054, receiving funds and making commissary purchases.

events.title: Money Transfer to Epstein's Prison Account
events.description: A $200.00 transfer was sent to Jeffrey Epstein's inmate account via Western Union.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Incarceration at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was processed into the New York MCC, with his first recorded cell assignment in House R, Range 01, Bed 001L.

events.title: Epstein's Commissary Purchases
events.description: A series of sales invoices show Epstein purchasing food, hygiene items, batteries, and electronics from the prison commissary, depleting his account balance.

locations: 675 AVE Z BK, NY 11223 (Epstein's listed address, likely related to his incarceration)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was held at the New York Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) under registration number 85993-054.
A $200 Western Union transfer was made to his inmate account on August 7, 2019, just days before his death.
His cell assignment history shows he was moved multiple times within the MCC between August 2018 and August 2019.
Commissary records from July 2019 show purchases of batteries, headphones, a radio, and extensive food items, suggesting he was actively using his account.
The documents provide a detailed financial and logistical paper trail of Epstein's life in federal custody in the year leading up to his death.
